title: Moong Dal Cheela (Savory Lentil Crepes)
description: Healthy, protein-packed savory crepes made from yellow lentils, perfect for breakfast or a light meal.

ingredients.name: water
ingredients.notes: for grinding and adjusting batter consistency

instructions.description: Drain the soaked moong dal completely.

In a blender, combine the drained dal, ginger, and green chili. Add a little water (start with 1/4 cup) and blend to a smooth, thick batter (like dosa batter consistency). Add more water only if needed.
Transfer the batter to a bowl. Add turmeric powder, asafoetida (if using), salt, chopped onion, and cilantro (if using). Mix well.
Check consistency. It should be pourable but not too thin. Add a tablespoon or two of water if it's too thick.
Heat a non-stick tawa or skillet over medium heat. Grease lightly with oil.
Once hot, pour a ladleful of batter onto the center and quickly spread it outwards in a circular motion to form a thin crepe (cheela).
Drizzle a few drops of oil around the edges.
Cook on medium-low heat for 2-3 minutes until the edges start to lift and the bottom is golden brown and crisp.
Flip the cheela and cook the other side for 1-2 minutes.
Fold the cheela in half and serve hot with green chutney or yogurt.
Repeat with the remaining batter, greasing the tawa lightly as needed.
